Examples of digital competencies in the context of planning assessment

Digital Safety

  • Ensure assessment data is handled securely and understand how it is protected.
  • Recognise the risks of dependency on machine feedback for children.
  • Acknowledge the long-term effects of digital footprints.
  • Prevent cyberbullying in online assessments.
  • Refer to “3.1. Digital safety: Key areas” for more information.

Accessibility & Inclusion

  • Offer alternative formats for diverse learning needs.
  • Perform user testing to identify specific learner requirements.
  • Guarantee tool compatibility with assistive technologies.
  • Address the digital divide in assessment access.
  • Refer to section 3.1 for more information.

Digital Work

  • Utilise key edtech tools for comprehensive assessments.
  • Employ digital recognition to encourage learners.
  • Implement measures to deter cheating in digital assessments.
  • Refer to section 3.1 for more information.

AI & Analytics

  • Understand adaptive learning mechanisms.
  • Explore AI-driven assessment strategies and question their decisions.
  • Be conscious of ethical considerations and AI limitations, ensuring human oversight.
  • Refer to section 3.1 for more information.
